replies.bodyText:
Created: when user start a historical detector, we will create one task to track the detector execution and set its state as CREATED
Initializing: after task created, coordinate node will gather all node’s state and dispatch task to the worker node with lowest load. When the worker node receives the request, it will set the task state as INIT immediately, then start to run cold start to train RCF model.

timeline.bodyText: minor: endTime can't be  null, right?
timeline.author: weicongs-amazon

replies.bodyText: Yes, for initial release, we plan to separate historical detector and realtime detector flow, so it's true the endTime can't be null. Next phase we will build universal flow, then the endTime could be null. If the endTime is null, we will pre-train model with historical data from startTime to now, then start realtime detection with the pre-trained model.
replies.author: ylwu-amzn
